festival.introText:
Reggae & Ska festival Summer Love comes to Maidstone's Mote Park in May 2023 after their successful debut in 2022.

There’s a whole lot more to Summer Love than just the stage entertainment, with its very own street food festival, serving the best in Caribbean cuisine, as well as other dishes from all over the world for the whole family to enjoy.

The parents can enjoy the event’s famous Summer Love rum punch, as well as our beer, cider and ale village and prosecco, gin and cocktail parlour whilst the little ones enjoy the funfair and other children’s activities – there really is something for everyone!

reviews.title: Review of Summer Love Festival
reviews.body: VIP wasn't in a good position

reviews.title: Review of Summer Love Festival
reviews.body: great event but rip off for food and drinks especially the token racket

reviews.title: Review of Summer Love Festival
reviews.body: Goid atmosphere.  Nice venue and great music. a great day in all.

reviews.title: Review of Summer Love Festival
reviews.body:
we had a good time except the cloudy weather.... lots of decent food stalls  but the prices was expensive.  some people just left there rubbish all over the place  & not enough bins set about the place.... big pat on the back for the in-house cleaners who tried to keep on top of all the rubbish around the place....they need more helpers + not enough toilet attendance to ensure toilet paper was available & to maintain hygiene within.but the toilet didn't smell....

overall....a good day had....ð??ð??ð??ð??ð??ð??ð??

faqs.question: What is included with VIP Tickets?
faqs.answer:
All VIP ticket holders will have exclusive access to the following: 

Fast track entry, access to private side-of-stage VIP bar, side-of-stage viewing area access, luxury toilets, relaxed seating area and free souvenir

reusable cup.

faqs.question: How to get to the Summer Love Festival?
faqs.answer:
TRAVELLING BY CAR

If you’re driving to the event, we would suggest parking in our official Summer Love car park, which is situated 200m from the event’s main entrance.

Parking tickets are available to purchase from the ticket section below.

You can also park in one of the many local car parks.

Please note, we strongly advise that you do not park in and around residential areas surrounding the park and doing so will run the risk of you

receiving a parking ticket. 

TRAVELLING BY TRAIN

Maidstone West Station – 1.3 miles from Mote Park 

Maidstone Barracks Station – 1.7 miles from Mote Park 

Maidstone East Station – 1.4 miles from Mote Park 

TRAVELLING BY BUS

The Mall Bus Station is located approximately one mile from Mote Park.

faqs.question: Are disabled tickets required?
faqs.answer:
Yes, disabled customers are required to purchase a ticket and then send the confirmation, as well as a photo/copy of their DLA/PIP letter to the festival

directly via their chat feature at www.parklivekent.com. They will then process the documents and provide them with a carer ticket free of charge.

faqs.question: When is Summer Love 2023?
faqs.answer: Summer Love Festival takes place on Saturday 27th May 2023.

faqs.question: I can no longer attend, what should I do?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately, due to policy, tickets are non-refundable unless the event is cancelled by us prior to opening. You are, however, welcome to sell/give

your tickets to a friend or family member. 

If the event is cancelled due to force majeure, including COVID-19 and government guidance, tickets will not be refunded but alternative dates will be offered.

The name on the ticket is virtually irrelevant, as long as the ticket’s bar code scans successfully. Please, however, be aware of ticket scammers and we

do not recommend purchasing tickets from anyone other than our official website.

We do not take any responsibility for tickets that do not scan successfully upon entry.

faqs.question: Will there be disabled toilets?
faqs.answer: Yes, there will be numerous disabled toilets on site.

faqs.question: Where is Summer Love?
faqs.answer:
The main Summer Love entrance will be situated opposite Mote Park Café, with Mote Park’s main entrance off Mote Avenue being the best way to

access the site. 

Address: Mote Ave, Maidstone ME15 7RN.

faqs.question: What can I bring into Summer Love?
faqs.answer:
- All food and drink (except 1×500 bottle of water per person – MUST BE SEALED) is not permitted to be brought into the event. There will be a variety of delicious food available for purchase inside the event, as well as fully stocked bars.

- The only animals that are permitted on site are registered guide dogs.

- you’re welcome to bring your own seating (folding, camping chairs) and blankets to sit on, however please be aware that these cannot be

placed directly in front of the stage because it creates a hazard. You must be behind the barriers, which will be clearly signposted.

faqs.question: Will there be a disabled viewing area?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately there will not be a specific disabled viewing area, however please show your blue badge upon arrival and our marshals will do their best to locate you as close to the stage as possible.

faqs.question: Can I pay via cash or card at Summer Love?
faqs.answer:
You won’t be able to purchase any food or drink at the event without tokens. After using tokens at a number of our events last year, we found

that using tokens for food and drink significantly speeds up service, which results in more time for you all to enjoy the event and less time

queueing for food and drinks. 

When purchasing food/drink with cash, staff will take money, get your items, go to the till and count your change out and then return with your

items and change, which take on average 2/3 minutes. With tokens, this is dramatically sped up, with tokens being taken and items

being passed to the customer, which takes around 20/30 seconds. Our token system also minimises the risk of COVID-19 transmission.

faqs.question: Is there disabled parking?
faqs.answer: There will be parking available for disabled customers in Mote Park’s over-flow car park.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Summer Love Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Great evening enjoyed all will definitely go again thanks

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Summer Love Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: the event was great, first time experienced token system which in hindsight it was great,but when rounding prices to tokens it worked out quite expensive for some products. I would definitely go again

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Summer Love Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body:
well organised, great bands an a good sound.
food an drink not to bad fir a concert venue.
went to rochester castle event last year an this year was much better run.. well done  9/10
